Claim: India asked for restriction of movement.
Explaination: The notification is from Malaysia and not India.
Label: False
html:
Claim: India asked for restriction of movement.

Explanation:The notification is from Malaysia and not India.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/coronavirus-notification-on-movement-restrictions-is-not-from-india-7280

Claim: The viral video claims mass graves are in Italy.
Explaination: The viral video is part of a TV series called Pandemic. The viral scene is not from Italy.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: The viral video claims mass graves are in Italy.

Explanation:The viral video is part of a TV series called Pandemic. The viral scene is not from Italy.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/viral-video-mass-graves-dead-bodies-italy-tv-series-pandemic-1660116-2020-03-26

Claim: Article overstates threat of coronavirus.
Explaination: The claims in the article are backed by science.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Article overstates threat of coronavirus.

Explanation:The claims in the article are backed by science.

https://analysis.leadstories.com/3471925-fact-check-coronavirus-act-today-or-people-will-die.html

Claim: Pope Francis and two aides tested positive for coronavirus.
Explaination: No official Vatican communication confirms this.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Pope Francis and two aides tested positive for coronavirus.

Explanation:No official Vatican communication confirms this.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471797-fact-check-vatican-confirms-pope-francis-and-two-aides-test-positive-for-coronavirus---mcm.html

Claim: “The State of Florida has announced measures that all workplaces with 10 employees or more are to have paid mandatory leave to avoid the spread of COVID-19 coronavirus starting on March 6, 2020. All schools are to close for 2 weeks also from March 6.”
Explaination: As of March 5, Florida is not shutting down schools and businesses for two weeks.
Label: False
html:
Claim: “The State of Florida has announced measures that all workplaces with 10 employees or more are to have paid mandatory leave to avoid the spread of COVID-19 coronavirus starting on March 6, 2020. All schools are to close for 2 weeks also from March 6.”

Explanation:As of March 5, Florida is not shutting down schools and businesses for two weeks.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/05/facebook-posts/no-statewide-school-and-business-closures-florida-/

Claim: Says Nancy Pelosi was “caught trying to include abortion funding in bill to combat coronavirus.”
Explaination: The U.S. House passed a measure that provides federal funds to people affected by the coronavirus. The bill covers reimbursement laboratory costs for COVID-19 testing. Some raised concerns that language was needed to specifically ensure abortion services weren't eligible to receive funds. The language was amended by Democrats to limit reimbursements to COVID-19 expenses.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Says Nancy Pelosi was “caught trying to include abortion funding in bill to combat coronavirus.”

Explanation:The U.S. House passed a measure that provides federal funds to people affected by the coronavirus. The bill covers reimbursement laboratory costs for COVID-19 testing. Some raised concerns that language was needed to specifically ensure abortion services weren't eligible to receive funds. The language was amended by Democrats to limit reimbursements to COVID-19 expenses.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/16/blog-posting/no-pelosi-wasnt-caught-trying-add-abortion-funding/

Claim: Photo shows food being distributed to Rwandans during coronavirus lockdown.
Explaination: The photos of piles of bedding and food are not from Rwanda, and have nothing to do with any coronavirus lockdown. They are of goods distributed by a sheikh in the Gambia during Ramadan, in May 2019.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Photo shows food being distributed to Rwandans during coronavirus lockdown.

Explanation:The photos of piles of bedding and food are not from Rwanda, and have nothing to do with any coronavirus lockdown. They are of goods distributed by a sheikh in the Gambia during Ramadan, in May 2019.

https://africacheck.org/fbcheck/food-distribution-during-rwandas-coronavirus-lockdown-no-photo-from-ramadan-in-the-gambia/

Claim: An image shows a train transporting the COVID-19 virus.
Explaination: The dark wagons on the image are the ones used to transport oil and they have to obey the 4 letters and 6 digits rules. That’s not what happens with the word “COVID-19” that appears in the image. Also, the name of the virus is Sars-Cov-2 and not COVID-19 (that’s the name of the disease). If the train was transporting the virus it would mention “Sars-Cov-2” and not “COVID-19”.
Label: False
html:
Claim: An image shows a train transporting the COVID-19 virus.

Explanation:The dark wagons on the image are the ones used to transport oil and they have to obey the 4 letters and 6 digits rules. That’s not what happens with the word “COVID-19” that appears in the image. Also, the name of the virus is Sars-Cov-2 and not COVID-19 (that’s the name of the disease). If the train was transporting the virus it would mention “Sars-Cov-2” and not “COVID-19”.

https://observador.pt/factchecks/fact-check-fotografia-mostra-comboio-a-transportar-o-virus-que-causa-covid-19/

Claim: “In Italy, they have thrown their money on the streets. A clear message to the whole world that money is not enough when health is in danger.”
Explaination: These photos show devalued Venezuelan bolivars in Venezuela in the spring of 2019.
Label: False
html:
Claim: “In Italy, they have thrown their money on the streets. A clear message to the whole world that money is not enough when health is in danger.”

Explanation:These photos show devalued Venezuelan bolivars in Venezuela in the spring of 2019.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/apr/09/facebook-posts/photos-show-money-streets-venezuela-2019-not-italy/

Claim: There is a case of COVID-19 in Alberta, Canada, on 2/5/20.
Explaination: Authorities denied it.
Label: False
html:
Claim: There is a case of COVID-19 in Alberta, Canada, on 2/5/20.

Explanation:Authorities denied it.

https://factcheck.afp.com/false-novel-coronavirus-warnings-circulating-alberta

Claim: All social media group admins are requested to close their groups for two days.
Explaination: There is no order of legal action to be taken against group admins if they don't close their groups for 2 days. There is no such restriction on citizens to share any news or updates about the coronavirus situation, as long as it is not false information.
Label: False
html:
Claim: All social media group admins are requested to close their groups for two days.

Explanation:There is no order of legal action to be taken against group admins if they don't close their groups for 2 days. There is no such restriction on citizens to share any news or updates about the coronavirus situation, as long as it is not false information.

https://english.factcrescendo.com/2020/04/08/messages-claiming-legal-action-to-be-taken-against-group-admins-is-false/

Claim: Photo on biography of a boy who died from coronavirus.
Explaination: The photo is incorrectly attributed to this story and is of an entirely different person unrelated to COVID-19.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Photo on biography of a boy who died from coronavirus.

Explanation:The photo is incorrectly attributed to this story and is of an entirely different person unrelated to COVID-19.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/04/fact-check-photo-on-biography-of-boy-who-died-of-coronavirus-is-NOT-ismail-mohamed-abdulwahab.html

Claim: KFC San Marino Shopping (Guayaquil, Ecuador) employee with COVID-19.
Explaination: Please click the link to read the full article
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: KFC San Marino Shopping (Guayaquil, Ecuador) employee with COVID-19.

Explanation:Please click the link to read the full article

http://www.ecuadorchequea.com/las-mentiras-sobre-el-covid-19-en-ecuador/

Claim: A man collapses in a staircase because of the CoV.
Explaination: The authorities and building management said he fainted for other reasons.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: A man collapses in a staircase because of the CoV.

Explanation:The authorities and building management said he fainted for other reasons.

https://factcheck.afp.com/sri-lankan-authorities-say-man-suffered-condition-unrelated-novel-coronavirus

Claim: Narendra Modi is giving free masks in India.
Explaination: A fake phishing website was set up in the name of Narendra Modi.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Narendra Modi is giving free masks in India.

Explanation:A fake phishing website was set up in the name of Narendra Modi.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/coronavirus-viral-forward-promising-free-masks-is-fake-7250

Claim: U.S. hospitals are preparing for 96 million coronavirus infections and nearly half a million deaths, leaked documents reveal.
Explaination: An infectious disease expert presenting to the American Hospital Association estimated there could be as many as 96 million cases of COVID-19 in the U.S. in a year. But there is no indication that hospitals are preparing, covertly, for an outbreak of that magnitude, as this headline suggests.
Label: False
html:
Claim: U.S. hospitals are preparing for 96 million coronavirus infections and nearly half a million deaths, leaked documents reveal.

Explanation:An infectious disease expert presenting to the American Hospital Association estimated there could be as many as 96 million cases of COVID-19 in the U.S. in a year. But there is no indication that hospitals are preparing, covertly, for an outbreak of that magnitude, as this headline suggests.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/13/facebook-posts/leaked-documents-dont-prove-us-hospitals-preparing/

Claim: Video clip of a massive stadium converted into a graveyard claimed to be scenes from Italy related to the ongoing COVID-19 outbreak.
Explaination: Scene from movie “Flu 2013” portrayed as scenes from Italy.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Video clip of a massive stadium converted into a graveyard claimed to be scenes from Italy related to the ongoing COVID-19 outbreak.

Explanation:Scene from movie “Flu 2013” portrayed as scenes from Italy.

https://srilanka.factcrescendo.com/english/fact-check-scene-from-korean-movie-flu-portrayed-as-scenes-from-italy/

Claim: Video posts viewed thousands of times purport to show South Africa’s President Cyril Ramaphosa announcing an alleged 81-day lockdown.
Explaination: But the video has been edited to change the context of an earlier speech he made during a national news broadcast. The TV channel which aired the original segment has refuted the doctored video and there have been no official announcements from the presidency to extend the ongoing 21-day lockdown set to end on April 16, 2020.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Video posts viewed thousands of times purport to show South Africa’s President Cyril Ramaphosa announcing an alleged 81-day lockdown.

Explanation:But the video has been edited to change the context of an earlier speech he made during a national news broadcast. The TV channel which aired the original segment has refuted the doctored video and there have been no official announcements from the presidency to extend the ongoing 21-day lockdown set to end on April 16, 2020.

https://factcheck.afp.com/video-was-edited-make-it-look-south-africas-leader-announced-81-day-lockdown

Claim: North Korean president has ordered to shoot the first coronavirus patient in his country.
Explaination: There is no credible media report which claims that North korea has ordered to shoot its first coronavirus patient.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: North Korean president has ordered to shoot the first coronavirus patient in his country.

Explanation:There is no credible media report which claims that North korea has ordered to shoot its first coronavirus patient.

https://aajtak.intoday.in/story/fact-check-corona-virus-north-korea-shoot-patient-1-1174989.html

Claim: A video of a Doctor of Mumbai’s Kasturba hospital suggesting tea and hot water to cure COVID-19.
Explaination: The video is not of a Doctor from the Kasturba hospital and there is no evidence that tea and hot water can cure COVID-19.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: A video of a Doctor of Mumbai’s Kasturba hospital suggesting tea and hot water to cure COVID-19.

Explanation:The video is not of a Doctor from the Kasturba hospital and there is no evidence that tea and hot water can cure COVID-19.

https://aajtak.intoday.in/story/fact-check-coronavirus-mumbai-kasturba-hospital-social-media-viral-post-covid-19-precaution-1-1176466.html

Claim: Video shows Chinese officials detaining suspected coronavirus cases.
Explaination: The video shows a police drill in China during the novel coronavirus epidemic.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Video shows Chinese officials detaining suspected coronavirus cases.

Explanation:The video shows a police drill in China during the novel coronavirus epidemic.

https://factcheck.afp.com/video-shows-police-drill-china-during-novel-coronavirus-epidemic?check=1

Claim: A video has been viewed thousands of times on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and YouTube alongside a claim it shows people rioting and looting shops in England during the coronavirus lockdown.
Explaination: The claim is false; the video has circulated online since August 2011 about riots in the British capital of London.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video has been viewed thousands of times on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and YouTube alongside a claim it shows people rioting and looting shops in England during the coronavirus lockdown.

Explanation:The claim is false; the video has circulated online since August 2011 about riots in the British capital of London.

https://factcheck.afp.com/video-shows-riots-london-2011-more-nine-years-covid-19-pandemic

Claim: The names of coronavirus victims have been published online in media.
Explaination: News organizations have repeatedly mention names of victims and have even done life tributes to them.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The names of coronavirus victims have been published online in media.

Explanation:News organizations have repeatedly mention names of victims and have even done life tributes to them.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/03/fact-check-coronavirus-victims-are-being-reported-by-the-news-media.html

Claim: A post says “hair weave and lace fronts manufactured in China may contain the coronavirus.”
Explaination: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration has found no evidence that the virus is spreading via imports.
Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: A post says “hair weave and lace fronts manufactured in China may contain the coronavirus.”

Explanation:The U.S. Food and Drug Administration has found no evidence that the virus is spreading via imports.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/feb/29/blog-posting/hair-extensions-arent-source-2019-coronavirus/

Claim: The mayor Of Buffalo told people to evacuate due to the coronavirus outbreak.
Explaination: The mayor denied this claim when he responded to a Facebook post spreading the misinformation.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The mayor Of Buffalo told people to evacuate due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Explanation:The mayor denied this claim when he responded to a Facebook post spreading the misinformation.
